name: Lion
description: A large cat with a prominent mane on males, known for living in prides. They are apex predators in their ecosystem.
fact: A lion's roar can be heard from up to 8 kilometers (5 miles) away.

name: Bald Eagle
description: A large bird of prey native to North America, known for its white head and tail feathers. It is the national bird of the United States.
fact: Bald eagles can fly to an altitude of 10,000 feet.

name: Blue Whale
description: The largest animal ever known to have existed, a marine mammal with a streamlined body. It feeds on small crustaceans.
fact: The blue whale's heart is the size of a small car and its tongue can weigh as much as an elephant.

name: Komodo Dragon
description: The world's largest living lizard, found on the Indonesian islands of Komodo. It uses a venomous bite to subdue prey.
fact: Komodo dragons can eat up to 80% of their body weight in a single meal.

name: Poison Dart Frog
description: A family of small, brightly colored frogs native to Central and South America. Their skin secretes a potent poison.
fact: The brilliant colors of poison dart frogs serve as a warning to predators.

name: Emperor Penguin
description: The tallest and heaviest of all living penguin species, endemic to Antarctica. They breed during the Antarctic winter.
fact: Emperor penguins can dive to depths of over 500 meters (1,640 feet).

name: Giraffe
description: The tallest living terrestrial animal and the largest ruminant. It is known for its extremely long neck and legs.
fact: Giraffes only need 5 to 30 minutes of sleep in a 24-hour period.

name: Red Panda
description: A small mammal native to the eastern Himalayas and southwestern China. It has a reddish-brown coat and a long, bushy tail.
fact: Despite its name, the red panda is not closely related to the giant panda.

name: Monarch Butterfly
description: A well-known migratory butterfly native to the Americas. They are known for their spectacular long-distance migration.
fact: Monarch butterflies migrate up to 3,000 miles (4,800 km) to escape cold weather.

name: Great White Shark
description: A large mackerel shark known for its size and powerful predatory nature. It is an apex predator of the ocean.
fact: The great white shark has no bones in its body; its skeleton is made of cartilage.

name: Pangolin
description: A nocturnal mammal covered in large, keratin scales. It is the only mammal with this unique armor.
fact: Pangolins can roll into a tight ball when threatened, protecting themselves with their scaly armor.

name: Bengal Tiger
description: A large carnivorous feline native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a powerful apex predator.
fact: The stripes on a tiger are as unique as a human's fingerprint.

name: Green Sea Turtle
description: A large sea turtle found in tropical and subtropical seas. Its name comes from the green fat beneath its shell.
fact: Green sea turtles can travel thousands of miles to return to the same beach where they were born to lay their eggs.

name: Fennec Fox
description: A small nocturnal fox native to the Sahara Desert. Its large ears help dissipate heat.
fact: The fennec fox's large ears can grow up to 15 cm (6 inches) long.

name: Koala
description: A herbivorous marsupial native to Australia. It has a rounded, tailless body and large nose.
fact: Koalas have fingerprints that are almost identical to human fingerprints.

name: Grizzly Bear
description: A large subspecies of brown bear found in North America. They have a prominent shoulder hump and long claws.
fact: Grizzly bears can run up to 35 mph, a surprising speed for their size.

name: Piranha
description: A freshwater fish known for its sharp teeth and powerful bite. They are found in South American rivers.
fact: Piranhas are not as aggressive as they are often portrayed and are primarily scavengers.

name: Tarsier
description: A small primate known for its extremely large eyes and long fingers. It is a nocturnal hunter of insects and small vertebrates.
fact: A tarsier's eyes are so large they cannot move them within their sockets.

name: Octopus
description: A soft-bodied marine mollusk with eight arms. They are highly intelligent and masters of camouflage.
fact: An octopus has three hearts and blue blood.

name: Western Gorilla
description: The most widespread of the gorilla subspecies. They live in social groups called troops led by a silverback male.
fact: Despite their intimidating size, gorillas are generally peaceful herbivores.
